name: Example Ridge Walk
summary: A scenic ridge walk with broad views over the surrounding countryside.
terrain: Field paths, farm tracks and a short rocky ridge section.

ai.summary: Example Ridge Walk is a moderate-intensity ridge trail in Test Region suitable for hikers with some experience. The route offers scenic views along exposed ridge sections and rolling terrain, with the exact distance not specified.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of rocky paths, firmer tread on the ridge, occasional scree, and forested sections at lower elevations. The trail is uneven underfoot with short climbs and descents; some exposed segments require caution in windy or wet conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and avoid the hike in high winds or heavy rain. Wear sturdy boots with good grip; stay on marked paths; watch for loose rocks on ridge sections; bring adequate water and sun protection; inform someone of your plans; cell service may be limited in remote areas; carry a lightweight headlamp or flashlight as a precaution.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Weather-appropriate layered clothing (base layer, insulating layer, wind/rain shell)
Water supply (2–3 liters) and a compact electrolyte option
Map and/or GPS device or a fully charged smartphone with offline maps
First aid kit and emergency whistle
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Light rain jacket and a warm layer for exposure
Compact emergency blanket or space blanket
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn in temperate regions; winter hiking is possible with proper gear and knowledge of snow/ice conditions.
